alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend; Inland Brazoria; Inland Matagorda; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 5:41PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Wharton, south central Fort Bend, west central Brazoria and north central Matagorda Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 541 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boling-Iago, or 11 miles southeast of Wharton. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Wharton, south central Fort Bend, west central Brazoria and north central Matagorda Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Fort Bend; Inland Brazoria; Inland Matagorda; Wharton
